info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 28 at 1:03AM CDT until March 28 at 2:30AM CDT by NWS Brownsville TX
info.description:
...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHEASTERN HIDALGO COUNTY...
At 103 AM CDT, Local law enforcement and emergency management have reported multiple ongoing water rescues in southeastern Hidalgo County. Between 6 and 11 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring.
This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for Southeastern Hidalgo County. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW!
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Law enforcement reported.
IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Harlingen, Weslaco, Donna, Mercedes, Progreso, Llano Grande, Weslaco East High School, Black Elementary School, Knapp Medical Center, Estero Llano Grande State Park, Isaac D. Rodriguez Park, Weslaco City Park, Weslaco Public Library, Weslaco Fire Department Station Two, Weslaco City Hall, South Texas High School For Health Professions, Harlon Block Sports Complex, Villa Verde, Weslaco Fire Department Station One and Alameda Park.
info.instruction:
Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
